boardgame.name: Junior Colourbrain
boardgame.description:
Junior Colourbrain is a colourful quiz for kids where they get all the answers before they start, and they’re all colours!

All the questions are based on things kids should know but adults might struggle with, such as, “What colour are Strawberry Millions?”

Using the 11 Colour Cards in your hand, players put down the correct colour (or colours) to win the card. If it’s a draw, it starts a rollover! Play the correct colours and your team can race ahead with the points... as long as some of the other teams get it wrong. First to reach 10 points, wins!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

boardgame.name: Happy Cats
boardgame.description:
You will need all your wits about you to come out on top in this game of competing cats.

Fluffy balls as far as the eye can see – a paradise for all cats! But make no mistake: none of them want to share. Each cat tries to grab as many of the fluffy balls as possible. But who will succeed with their clever card play?

The aim of the game is to collect as many fluffy balls as possible and end up with the most points – with some skillful card play.

The game ends when the last fluffy ball is taken.

The player with the highest total score wins.

listing.notes: Title: Happy cats Publisher: Piatnik Language(s): English German French

boardgame.name: Jeu de l'Oie: Les Salamandres de Beauvais
boardgame.description:
The Salamanders of Beauvais is a trivia-goose game that lets you discover the city of Beauvais in northern France.
As in the goose game there is chance, a maze, traps, a prison...
but also, as in Trivial Pursuit, questions, 330 that allow players to progress in the game on sport, history, cinema ...
It contains 62 boxes illustrated with old photos of the streets and monuments of Beauvais or of its outstanding personalities.

However, you can count on the help of the magic Salamander to progress in the game...

boardgame.name: ひつじの国のアリス (Hitsuji no kuni no Alice)
boardgame.description:
ひつじの国のアリス (Hitsuji no kuni no Alice) is a game from Japan, where Alice causes trouble in the Land Of Sheep.

Alice suddenly appears in the Land Of Sheep, which is ruled by the Queen of Sheep. Alice behaves poorly! She enters somebody's house and eats their cookies without permission, and goes into another house and drinks without permission too! She ruins a tea party, disturbs the Queen's cricket match, and so on!

Finally, Alice promised to leave, but only if she was given lots of souvenirs to take home.

In the game, the players use white sheep to collect souvenirs for Alice. The game is a semi-co-operative game, with players working together to get Alice out, but also competing to provide the most popular souvenirs.

As Alice moves around, different souvenir tokens appear on the game board. Players place their sheep tiles adjacent to the tokens they want to collect. The highest value sheep will take the token, using a 'butting' mechanism, like Hols der Geier, with equal values cancelling out. Players also have black sheep, which can trump the white sheep of equal value.

The best souvenirs score the most points, but Alice is fickle and her tastes change as she progresses along the path. The souvenirs are ranked, but the order of their rank changes during the game.

When she finally reaches the gate, the game ends. Once the final score is determined, players turn up the ending cards, and discover what kind of end the Land Of Sheep has.
user summary

boardgame.name: Farthest Frontier
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Protect and guide your people as you forge a town from untamed wilderness at the edge of the known world.Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Secrets of Emerald Hill: A Murder Mystery Game
boardgame.description:
At the outer reaches of London's most sought-after postcode sits Emerald Hill, the city's highly exclusive gated community. When Mr. Addington, the snobbish owner of the estate, is found dead on the marble floor of his en suite bathroom, it's clear that his death was no accident. Each of the residents, from Tiffany the VHS fitness queen to Keith the daytime soap heartthrob, is hiding an explosive secret, but only one of them would go so far as to kill in order to protect that secret!

Set in the 80s, when hair was big and shoulder pads were bigger, this immersive murder mystery will see you and your fellow dinner guests become both murder suspects and detectives for the evening. Will you be able to unravel the clues, pinpoint the motives and solve the murder before coffee is served?

boardgame.name: よくばりハンターズ！ (Greedy Hunters!)
boardgame.description:
よくばりハンターズ！ (Greedy Hunters!) is a traitor game from Japan. The players work together, exploring a dangerous dungeon, and try to recover the treasures within. But when the party tries to leave, then the traitors try to gain the upper hand.

At the start of the game, the players are dealt a secret hidden role; either they are Hunters, or Greedy. As the players explore the dungeon, battling monsters and avoiding traps, a player's special abilities might reveal what their true character.

Players draw action cards and play through similar to a role-playing game. When the dungeon is cleared, as the players climb out, the Greedy traitors try to steal from the others. At the end of the game, the richest Hunter and the richest Greedy both win.
user summary

boardgame.name: 箱庭キングス (Hakoniwa Kings)
boardgame.description:
箱庭キングス (Hakinowa Kings) is a game from Japan themed around the seasons, with cards representing people from kingdoms that identify with Spring, Summer, Fall, and Winter. Players use cards like workers in a worker placement game. An opening card draft allows you to build a winning strategy from the very beginning.

Players compete to accumulate 15 resource points or construct 3 buildings to win. All players begin with the same 4 unbuilt buildings and 6 drafted cards. Buildings not only lead to a possible victory, they also provide helpful bonuses as long as they remain complete. Each turn progresses through 4 phases: the Seasonal Phase, Construction Phase, Action Phase, and End Phase.

In the Seasonal Phase, players take different actions depending on the season marked on the Season Board. In Spring, players gain a free card. In Summer, players can build for free. In Fall, players gain free resource points. And in Winter, players reduce the resource points or hurt the buildings of unprotected players.

In the Construction Phase, buildings that are partially built will progress on their own. Players may also spend a resource point to help one building along. In the Action Phase, players will play Action Cards. Some cards can only be played in certain seasons or when players have completed certain buildings. If no player has reached a victory condition in the End Phase, players continue with the next season.

Choose your cards wisely as you decide your path to victory!

user summary

boardgame.name: No Stone Unturned (Adam Bell)
boardgame.description:
No Stone Unturned is a gmless game about exploring a world long after societal collapse. It's designed to be played as a one- shot or a short campaign of 3-5 sessions.

The game starts with a worldbuilding phase. Together, all of the players will come up with a broad setting, and then define the settlement that their characters are living in and working to help grow. Then, each player privately creates other locations in the world using the holy grail of indie tabletop rpg tech, the blank notecard. These are then shuffled and spread out face down on the table as a map of unknown locations for the players to explore.

You could end here and switch to a different game if you wanted to, honestly. The worldbuilding steps in this game are pretty good and easily ported elsewhere. Assuming you're sticking with it, the next step is to create characters. Characters in No Stone Unturned are made up of stats, moods, skills, and sentiments. Each of these get everyone on the table on the same page as to who each character is, what they're good at doing, and what they care about.

Then the game plays out in a cycle of adventure and downtime. On adventures, you'll be exploring the locations on the map you've built out. Be warned though, because these locations are full of other burgeoning societies, wildlife, and unstable ecosystems. Any careless move can have drastic impacts on what already lives in the world.

At any point on the adventure, a character might perform an action that endangers them or the world around them. That's when you roll dice and bring in those stats, moods, and sentiments that you built in character creation to determine the outcome and add details to the world around you.

In downtime, the players reckon with the consequences of their adventure and try to make use of whatever they found by addressing their wounds, making plans to repair any collateral damage they did to the world, and taking time to reflect on how they are feeling. After some time, it's back to another adventure.

boardgame.name: Jenga: Super Mario
boardgame.description:
A Nintendo-licensed, Super Mario-themed version of Hasbro's popular block-stacking dexterity game Jenga, with some added twists.

Players choose to play as Mario, Luigi, Princess Peach, or Toad, taking a character peg with that character on and slotting it into blocks near the base of the tower. Each turn, a player uses the spinner to determine how many layers up the tower their character peg can climb, and how many blocks they have to remove from the tower and stack on top of it. Blocks are marked with symbols that may cause players to gain or lose coins. Coins can also be gained from climbing the tower or defeating Bowser, who begins at the top of the tower and has to be beaten by climbing past him.

The game ends when someone collapses the tower, at which point the player with the most coins wins.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Video Game Theme: Super Mario Bros.

boardgame.description:

boardgame.name: Six Gun Sound: Devil's Elbow
boardgame.description:
Rob banks like Jesse James...enforce the law like Wyatt Earp...or maybe find something in between. If they did it, so can you with Six Gun Sound. With over 15 unique "professions" Six Gun Sound lets you experience the Wild West to the fullest.

Six Gun Sound is a fast paced set of "cowboy" rules that allows you to refight history or make your own. Whether you choose to fight a "one up" battle or string together a series of adventures, Six Gun Sound can do it all. Six Gun Sound is easy to learn yet entertaining for both veteran and novice players.

Set in the Old West from 1876-85 Six Gun Sound covers the Lincoln County War, the unpleasantness in Tombstone, the "Demise of the James Younger Gang," and the Great Sioux War of 76 as well as the founding of Deadwood and the death of Bill Hickok. And did we mention Apaches?

Six Gun Sound allows you to either fight unrelated gunfights or link them all together with a seamless and easy to use Campaign System. Watch your characters grow as they advance in skill making their way through the Old West. Bank robberies, cattle rustling, jail breaks, range wars, and more are at your finger tips with Six Gun Sound.

Six Gun Sound works with ANY figures you may already have and in any scale! Play solo, play on the same side, or play head-to-head -- it's your choice. So pop in your favorite Western movie and saddle up for adventure. And remember --- JUST PLAY THE GAME!
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Six Gun Sound: Blaze of Glory!

boardgame.name: Spouse-ology 2nd Edition
boardgame.description:
How to play:


Make sure each couple has an answer board, one dry erase marker, and three Off Script tokens to share.
The game is played in rounds. For the first round, each couple will answer an "Ask Her question Ladies first
Choose a couple to go first
The couple who goes first will roll the die to see which category question to answer from the "Ask Her" card.
The couple reads the designated question aloud, along with the multiple choice answers
Each husband writes the answer he believes his wife will choose (A, B, C, D. or E) on his answer board. The couples will take tums revealing their answers by each wife announcing her answer verbally-followed by her husband presenting his written answer to the group.
Matching answers earn 1 point, or 2 points with a 2x roll, or 3 points when an Off Script token is used.
The couple to the left rolls next!
On to round two.










Couples should not talk when being asked a question or while writing their answers, and they should be certain written answers cannot be seen by their spouse until it is time to reveal their answers. Have fun!

Off Script-After hearing the question, but before answering it, the couple has the option of choosing to use one of their three "Off Script" tokens to triple their point potential for that turn by selecting "E." A matching answer is worth 3 points

Wild Card - The couple who rolls the Wild Card chooses the category for the table for that round.

Double points-All correct answers will be worth 2 points intead of 1, and the couple rolls again to determine the category. (If the Wild Card is rolled again, they may choose the category, and if they roll the 2x again, they may roll yet again until they get a category rall.)

3 Ways to Win! Be the: 1) 1st couple to score 3 points in each category or 2) couple with the most points after a designated number of rounds or 3) couple with the most points at the end of a designated time frame

boardgame.name: Friends: Draw It
boardgame.description:
This fun game is your chance to show off your love for all things Friends The Television Series, and how well you can bring to life what is on the card before the time runs out.
Everything you need is supplied for you and your friends to play this fast-paced fun game. Includes a sand timer, 2x pencils, a pad of paper and 50x question cards. Draw and guess what's written on the cards.
Why not gather your friends and family at your next game night or party and bring out the Friends Draw It game. Supplied in a closed printed box for easy storage and also makes a great gift for fans of this iconic comedy series.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: King's Archer
boardgame.description: A card game in which you swiftly assemble the three hallmarks of a great archer...the bow, the arrow and the heart! Players build three numerical sequences from their hand - the archer’s bow, archer’s arrow and archer’s heart - laying them down on the table as they are achieved. Sequences of all one color or without wild cards are more valuable. Players can disrupt one another’s sequences with thieves - stealing cards right out from underneath their opponents. Players need good judgement to weigh the odds, strategic cunning to go for speed or purity, and bit of luck to see them through. Each successive round gets more tense as points are accumulated to determine the winner.

boardgame.name: Towers & Turrets
boardgame.description:
Welcome young peasant! Towers & Turrets is a strategic tower-building card game that allows you to compete against other players to build the tallest, purest, and coolest towers your kitchen table has ever seen. But be careful young peasant. Other players are out to get you!

In this 2-5 players game you strategically build and defend your towers while attacking those of other players. Points are scored by completing towers. The taller the tower and the more pure the building materials the higher points gained. Be the first to 100 points to win.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Good Question!
boardgame.description:
The goal of Good Question! is to prompt your Alexa-enabled device (not included) to say the word on your card without saying the word yourself.
Play consists of questions from five categories of cards like “5 Second Shout,” “Streak,” or “Impossibles.” Players may ask questions such as: “Alexa, what are synonyms for cross-country?” or “Alexa, who sings Hound Dog?” and get Alexa to say the word on the card.

Every time Alexa says the word on your card, move one space forward on the board. Be the first player to make it all the way around the board and to become the Good Question Master! Good Question! is a party game for two to six players.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Necromunda: House of Artifice
boardgame.description:
Necromunda is a vast machine and the sons and daughters of House Van Saar are its engineers. While other clans and Noble Houses have been content to embrace the slavish traditions of the Imperium, in particular its superstitious fear of technology, those of House Van Saar have sought to unravel the mysteries of Humanity’s lost age of advancement and progress. At times during their long history, their actions have brought them close to tech-heresy, and only the extreme secrecy of their Archeotek cabals and the benevolence of House Helmawr – which benefits most from their innovation – have protected them.

Get the ultimate guide to House Van Saar. This 128-page book features the definitive history of the House and rules for fielding the six different types of fighters available to House Van Saar – Primes, Augmeks, Archeoteks, Neoteks, Teks, and Subteks. It's ideal for fans of House Van Saar or anyone who wants to delve deeper into the dark side of the underhive.

Inside this book, you'll find:

• History of the House of Artifice

• House Van Saar Gangs: Updated rules for creating and running House Van Saar gangs, including two new Van Saar gang fighters - the technological Archeoteks and the grav-cutter riding Neoteks.

• Hired Guns, Hangers-on, and Dramatis Personae: Rules for adding Bounty Hunters, Hive Scum, and House Agents to your game, as well as Van Saar specific Dramatis Personae such as Von Buren (the rogue Archeotek) and Lisbeth "Iron Angel" (the arachni-rig pilot).

• Expanded Rules: Additional rules for running House Van Saar gangs.

• House Van Saar Scenarios: A collection of scenarios dedicated to the House of Artifice.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Buch der Champions 2020
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Tome of Champions 2020
boardgame.description:
The Tome of Champions 2020 is an essential companion to Warcry, no matter how you like to play. From new narrative content to twists for matched play and fresh open play game modes, it’s packed with updated rules and ideas to inspire you. Monstrous melees and incredible quests await.
Inside this book, you'll find:

• Rules for embarking on a deadly Trial of Champions campaign or battling multiple rival warbands in brutal Pit Fights

• A campaign system in which you explore the city of Soroth Kor, featuring expanded territory rules and treasures to be discovered

• New lesser artefact tables specific to each Grand Alliance

• Cooperative challenge battles against deadly wild fighters

A copy of the Warcry Core Book is necessary to use the contents of this book.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Starter Set

boardgame.name: Adeptus Titanicus: Crucible of Retribution
boardgame.description:
When the Horus Heresy broke out, the galaxy fell into turmoil. In the Belt of Iron, an area characterised by a preponderance of forge worlds, long-held grievances turned into outright war between Mechanicum factions, and the Titan Legions aligned with the various forge world marched in defence of their allies…

Discover the dramatic events of the Cataclysm of Iron, when forge world fought forge world, in this 96-page hardback supplement for Adeptus Titanicus. Harness the strengths of seven different Titan Legions using two new maniples, and bring the might of four Knight Households to bear against your enemies. Play out the story across four narrative missions – or create your own with new Echoes of Glory rules that provide you with powerful tools to play your games in whatever manner you choose.

Inside this book you will find:

• An overview of the Cataclysm of Iron campaign

• Background and Legion-specific rules for seven Titan Legions: Atarus, Astraman, Ignatum, Venator, Laniaskara, Kulesaetai, Damicium, and Tritonis

• Two new maniples to use in your games

• Background and rules for four Knight Houses: Col'Khak, Moritain, Gotrith, and Vextrix

• Full colour examples of paint schemes and heraldry for Titans and Knights

• Four narrative missions based on the dramatic events of the story

• Echoes of Glory rules for creating your own missions across five mission types and three world types
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Adeptus Titanicus – The Horus Heresy (Games Workshop)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy Rules Set

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Catacombs: Board Pack
boardgame.description:
Explore haunted ruins, mind-bending labyrinths, profane temples, and infernal forges as you quest for glory – but beware, for death is always waiting in the shadows to claim the unworthy…

Test your tactical skills and try new, thematically rich battlefields in Warcry with this board set! Designed to work with Warcry: Catacombs, each of these boards offers a thrilling new set of opportunities. Brave the twisting Lair of the Sphiranx, fight in the tight confines of the Cinder Warrens, dominate the centre ground in Halls of Velorum, and weave between the columns of the Temple of Nagendra – combined with the Warcry: Catacombs set, this promises hours of fun and variety.

This set contains two double-sided 760mm x 568mm game boards, plus a booklet with tips and rules for adding them to your games. Please note – you'll need a copy of Warcry: Catacombs to make use of this set.

—description from the publisher

You're a motley crew of Freebooters with mixed motives. Will you claim your prize from the fleet? Or will you be overcome, damned, or broken by the attempt?

The Devil and the Deep Blue Sea is a tabletop roleplaying game inspired by works like Pirates of the Caribbean, The Odyssey, and "The Mariner's Revenge Song," that will help you tell an allegorical high seas story about a crew of Freebooters and their attempt to raid the Armada of the Damned.

boardgame.name: Die Reise durch Daisho
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

Sprechende Schlangen, freundliche Tee-Dämonen, ein Pfeife rauchender Drache – das und viele weitere Überraschungen erwarten euch in Die Reise durch Daisho! In diesem Erzählspiel wird gewaltlose Konfliktlösung belohnt und euer Geschick herausgefordert. Ihr gestaltet die Welt gemeinsam und könnt euch beim Charakterbau so richtig ausleben.
Die Reise durch Daisho eignet sich für zwei bis vier Spieler*innen plus Spielleitung und ist für One Shots sowie Kampagnen mit sechs bis zehn Sitzungen geeignet. Außer diesem Buch braucht ihr nur ein paar sechsseitige Würfel und, optional, guten Tee.
Viel Spaß auf eurer Reise!

user summary (English)
In this game you play guardians keeping the balance on a pair of islands inspired by far Eastern cultures and fantasy. Violence has dire consequences, non-violence is encouraged. Conflict resolution used several d6 and has an element of dexterity (stacking) in addition to rolling.

The 2020 edition by System Matters includes a sample scenario and some advice for the GM.

boardgame.name: Cakes!
boardgame.description:
At Chef Sweeter’s bakery, everybody is working at full speed! We have to make huge and delicious cakes. Who will be the fastest baker? Will you be able to make the highest cake?
The object of the game is to make the highest cake (10 layers) according to the orders you receive, keeping in mind that balance plays an important role.

Players place their Plates on their hands. On top of these Plates, they will stack the layers of their cakes depending on the Order card (one layer, two layers…). In order to do so, each player draws 2 Sponge Cake cards and places them in a way they can put a Frosting card on top of the Sponge cake. In following turns, they will stack layers on top of the ones that are already on their Plates.

The game ends when at least one of the following conditions is fulfilled:
• A player makes a 10 layer cake, without it collapsing, and rings the bell.
• The Order deck runs out of cards. In that case, players tally their points. The player with the most points wins the game (Order cards grant points according to their difficulty).
In case of a tie, the tied players share the victory.
Remember! There are 2 strategies to get the victory:
• Stack the layers very quickly, with a high risk that your cake will collapse,
• Or make the cake slowly in order to get the 10 layers.

La pastelería del Chef Sweeter está a todo gas. Debemos elaborar grandes y deliciosas tartas. ¿Qué pasteleros serán los más rápidos? ¿Serás capaz de elaborar la tarta más alta?
El objetivo del juego es construir la tarta más alta (10 pisos) según los pedidos que vayan surgiendo, teniendo en cuenta que el equilibrio juega un papel fundamental.

Los jugadores colocarán una bandeja en su mano y, sobre ella, construirán los pisos de la tarta en función de lo que mande la carta de pedido (un piso, dos pisos,…). Para ello, toman dos cartas plegadas de bizcocho, y las colocan de tal forma que puedan poner sobre ellas una carta redonda de cobertura. En turnos posteriores, construirán pisos sobre los que ya tuvieran en su bandeja.

El juego termina cuando se cumpla, al menos, una de estas condiciones:
• Un jugador elabore una tarta de 10 pisos sin que se caiga y pulse el timbre.
• Se terminen todas las cartas de pedido. En este caso, se cuentan los puntos conseguidos por cada jugador y gana quien más puntos haya obtenido. (Las cartas de pedido tienen puntos según su dificultad).
En caso de empate, se comparte la victoria. Recuerda que existen 2 estrategias para conseguir la victoria:
• Elaborando pisos de la tarta rápidamente, con mucho riesgo de que se caiga, o
• construyendo la tarta despacio con el fin de llegar a 10 pisos.

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Implo
boardgame.description:
Introduction

Implo is a finite territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square board. The recommended board sizes are between 6x6 and 10x10. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones and markers of their own color.



Definitions

In these rules, "adjacent" always means "orthogonally adjacent".

A group is a piece along with all other pieces one could reach from it through a series of steps between identical adjacent pieces. Thus, all pieces in a group are the same type (stone or marker) and color (black or white).

The size of a group is the number of pieces in it.

Likewise, a territory is an empty point along with all other points one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent empty points.

A patch is a territory including at most four points.

The owner of a patch is the player with the biggest group of stones adjacent to it. If there is no such group or the biggest such groups of both colors are the same size, the owner of the patch is the opponent of the player who placed the last stone on the board.

To resolve a patch is to place a marker of its owner's color on each of its points and to remove the biggest group of stones which is adjacent to the patch and owned by the same player as the patch. If several such groups are tied for biggest, the player who is resolving the patch removes, among those, one of their choosing. If there are no groups of stones adjacent to the patch, no group is removed. Note the player resolving the patch need not be the owner of the patch.



Play

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, perform these actions in order:

1. Place a stone of your color on an empty point of the board.

2. Resolve any single patch on the board.

3. Repeat the previous step until no patches remain. Note the order of resolving matters, and resolving a patch may create new patches.

If, at the end of a player's turn, there are no empty points on the board, the game ends. The player with the higher score in the final position wins.

Your score is the biggest group size in which you have the greater number of groups of markers. If there is no such size, your score is zero. If both players are tied at zero points, whoever has more stones on the board wins. If this is also tied (only possible on even-sized boards), whoever made the last move loses.



Pie rule

The pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means White will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.

boardgame.name: Rory's Story Cubes: Doraemon
boardgame.description:
Create new Doraemon stories with this 50th aniversary special edition.

2020年に原作50周年を迎えたドラえもんの『ローリーズストーリーキューブス』

boardgame.name: Timmy im Zoo
boardgame.description:
New adventure with Timmy: He goes to the zoo and it is time to feed the animals! Together with Timmy, the players visit the different enclosures and feed the animals with their favourite food. The doublesided game board with a 3D structure offers both a land and a water side full of cute, child-friendly illustrations.

The game board of Timmy im Zoo is embedded in the bottom of the box and shows four different animals waiting to be fed with their mouths open. Each player has a matching food piece for each animal. The dice decide which food may be fed - of course only to the right animal. The first player to distribute all his food to the animals first wins the game.

listing.notes: Title: Timmy im Zoo Publisher: Pegasus Spiele Language(s): German

boardgame.name: Festive Trivia Quiz
boardgame.description: The game comes with a deck of fifty cards, each containing one Christmas-themed question, and an instruction sheet. In turn, each player is asked the question on the top card of the deck. A player keeps the card for scoring purposes when giving the correct response to the question. Cards answered incorrectly go to the bottom of the deck. The first player to score five correct answers is the winner.

boardgame.name: Trapped: The Carnival
boardgame.description:
Escape Room Game Pack
Series 1, Room 3
Difficulty level: EASY

TRAPPED turns any room into a family-friendly escape-room adventure... In The Carnival, it's your lifelong dream to work alongside the fabled fortune teller and jaw-dropping performers of Muggins Carnival... Soon after you apply, The Ringmaster invites you to an interview you'll never forget!

Nothing's what it seems as you perform the admission tests: a series of baffling puzzles and mysteries. Race head-to-head with your friends and family to see who'll be crowned King or Queen of the Carnival.

Carnival is less an “escape” room, and more a series of puzzles that exist just for the fun of it. There is no clear progression of the game, with an end goal of escaping. But rather the goal is to solve the Ringmaster’s puzzles and be awarded points. How you choose to play, is up to you, however. You may choose to split into teams (or individuals) and solve all of the puzzles, competing for the best score.

-description from the publisher's website

listing.notes:
Like new; played through once, and completely reset back to its original state. We used 2 of the score sheets, there are still 4 left untouched.
Shipping $5
I prefer Venmo or Amazon gift card for payment.

Trapped: The Carnival
[b]Edition:[/b] SolidRoots, 2020 [b]Language:[/b] English language [b]Language Dependance:[/b] Medium , Some necessary in-game text
[b]Condition:[/b] Brand New and unplayed.
[b]Other:[/b] Smoke free home

boardgame.name: Clockwork Wars: Discovery Mat
boardgame.description: 1x custom "Discovery Card Mat" on which to place and organize your discovery cards for easy viewing (this item is not included in the game). We will be printing these using the latest material, that "grips" your table, and is both durable and aesthetically appealing.

boardgame.name: The Day the Law Died
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

CAL IS WATCHING YOU!

Mega-City One is being terrorised under the heel of the tyrannical Chief Judge Cal and only the implacable Judge Dredd seems willing to stand in his way. Framed for murder and derided as the worst type of criminal during Cal’s grab for ultimate power, Dredd is soon hailed as the only person capable of standing in the megalomaniac’s way.

As the Big Meg trembles under Cal’s terrifying grip, will you join the Judges conditioned into supporting him or stand with the small band of rebels dedicated to bringing his reign to an end?

The Day the Law Died provides an in-depth treatise on the Special Judicial Squad, the Justice Department’s stern internal affairs branch, additional species options such as troggies and Kleggs, several career choices for civilians, perps, and Judges, new equipment and vehicles, a full gazetteer covering the timeline of Cal’s reign and how best to survive it, plus a number of exciting scenarios, including a ride on the Helter Skelter. Set during Chief Judge Cal’s despotic reign over the Justice Department and Mega-City One, this supplement will offer some tough choices for players of the Judge Dredd & the World of 2000 AD roleplaying game.
boardgame.rpg: Judge Dredd and the Worlds of 2000 AD

boardgame.name: A Change of Heart
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There is continued unrest in the cities around the Moonsea. The Red Wizards are rumored to be kidnapping visitors—but why? Ylraphon is one of those cities and is in danger from a growing threat from Thayan extremists.

Part 1 of the When Shadows Fall series.

A Four Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

Note: DM discretion is advised. Discuss limits on gore and character death before starting play. The adventure is intended to be a roller coaster and not a death trap.

boardgame.name: Pâtée Impériale
boardgame.description:
Pâtée Impériale is a game of strategy cards, combinations and memory to be played individually or in teams of two.

Form the best suite of courtiers in order to obtain the most prestige points and get noticed by the emperor.

Each player starts with an equal number of cards in hand. Players take turns choosing a card and performing the described action.

At the end of 3 rounds, you should have accumulated the most prestige points than your opponents to win the game.

boardgame.name: Starship Deckplans: Volume II
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This digital product contains a series of high-resolution starship deckplans in PNG format with transparent backgrounds. These deckplans are the sample starships from the Starship Deckbuilder Kit series from Paths to Adventure. If you would like to build your own custom starship deckplans in this style be sure to check out the kits. The file name of each PNG included in this product indicates which kit was used to compile the specific deckplans.

boardgame.name: In the Land of the Dead God
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This adventure for D&D 5E is aimed at level 5 characters, lasting 1-2 sessions.

Travel through a post-apocalyptic wasteland full of deadly dinosaurs, relax in a market town with tame dinosaurs, and bring an unscrupulous trading organization to justice!

Featuring:

23 pages of adventure, lasting about 4-6 hours!
Several custom handouts to bring the world alive to your players!
Custom maps for all encounters, plus a bunch you don't actually need because I got carried away!
Overly paleontolgically scientific dinosaurs, assuming wikipedia is accurate!
5 new custom monster stat blocks, 3 of them dinosaurs!
A chase scene that is also a battle and also happens on dinosaurs!
Several factions and NPCs in a unique setting, providing jumping off points for more dinosaur-themed adventures!

boardgame.name: 9 Wasteland Maps
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A series of maps themed around outdoor encounters.

Includes the chase scene maps [for use with] In the Land of the Dead God.

boardgame.name: Lunarian Delegate Class Ships
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Starship Builder Kit has been designed to allow you to utilize various stylized starship sections to compile your very own custom starship deckplan. You can use any graphics editing software that support PNG format to combine the piec-es, drop them directly into your favorite virtual tabletop (VTT) application, or even print and cut them out to be put together to make a tabletop play map.

This series of kits is designed to allow you to mix-and-match any of the sections included herein with sections included in other sets in the series.

Herein you will find over 20 ship sections including three sample ships built utilizing the included resources are area sections.

With Starship Builder Kits it is easy to create your own high-quality starship deckplans!

boardgame.name: Odd Occurrences!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Odd Occurrences! is a collection of 36 city encounters for use with the Troika! roleplaying game. Following a virtually useless page of introduction (after all, you are bright enough to know what to do with encounter ideas), you will find a selection of d66 events to populate almost any bizarre cityscape . . . including the city from which the game takes its name!

boardgame.name: 100 Features of the Underearth Realms
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This supplement has 100 different features and items to find in the underearth realms, the natural caves and caverns that lie beneath the deepest dungeons. Many of the results are the residue of intelligent underearth civilisations and peoples. Some may be interesting, some may be odd and some might be hazardous.

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Three Sisters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A dirty street urchin has sold you a map to the fabled Tomb of the Three Sisters. Rumors speak of untold treasures there, but only if you can make it out alive...

boardgame.name: Delver's Folly
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your party of fearless adventurers have stumbled across a dungeon to delve. Will you make it out alive? Or will you find that descending into the dungeon has been... folly?

boardgame.name: Broken Ground
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Take your game experience to the next level! "Broken Ground," a digital file, provides a versatile backdrop to a variety of games and RPG adventures. Its mix of earthy brown and lush green shades is countered by rugged, broken stone (or is it ore? or dragon scales?) peering through the natural landscape, suggesting that challenge - and even danger - are not far below the surface.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: 44 x 30 Combat Patrol Incursion PDF Version

boardgame.name: Western Pack 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a mixed Western themed map pack featuring some city encounter maps, as well as a few wilderness. All maps are 21x17 or 3300x2550 and made specifically for VTT

boardgame.name: Sci-fi Derelict
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a sci-fi Themed map pack, suitable for a variety of encounters and developed specifically for VTT. All maps are 22x17 and come with and without a grid.

boardgame.name: Swamp Pack 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a 5 pack of bandit camps, ruined altars, creepy trees, and more all set is a dreary swamp. All of these maps are 22x17 grids or 3300x2550px for VTT.

boardgame.name: Snowy Forest 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a 10 map pack for snowy environs. All of the images are 3300x2550 and grid out to be 22x17.

boardgame.name: Snowy Forest 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a 10 map pack for snowy environs. All of the images are 3300x2550 and grid out to be 22x17.

boardgame.name: Caverns 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Here is a series of maps for Cavern environments featuring a variety of lighting and developed for VTT. All of them measure 3300x2550 or 22x17

boardgame.name: Dungeon Pack 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Here is a series of maps for Dungeon environments featuring a variety of lighting and developed for VTT. All of them measure 3300x2550 or 22x17

boardgame.name: RPGPundit Presents: World of the Last Sun
boardgame.description:
RPGPundit Presents

World of the Last Sun

Old School Gonzo-Fantasy Setting

Publisher's blurb:

This is a compilation of Gonzo-Fantasy material from various issues of RPGPundit Presents. It is not simply these issues thrown together. Rather, this tome acts as a sourcebook for RPGPundit's World of the Last Sun gonzo-fantasy setting. It features...


Details of the World of the Last Sun.
Multiple Regional Campaign Locations that can also be added to your own worlds.
Weird fantasy races.
High-tech fantasy Equipment.
Rules for ordinary and magical drugs.
Rules for Skyship Combat.
Random encounter and location tables.
Random tables for weird character origins and encounters.

boardgame.name: Godstar
boardgame.description:
An Epic Science Fiction Roleplaying Setting

From the introduction:

Within the Million Sun Empire sits a desert world orbiting a sentient star: god-himself-the Godstar. Pilgrims flock to it with their offerings. The Godstar's oracles gives out advice, formulae, prognostications and strategy. It is a holy world. But war forced industrialisation on the planet Aurelia, causing social tension and conflict.

A new noble house, House Pelinor, has been granted the fiefdom of Aurelia, but it has many enemies: the local Utani Sand Men, the priests of the Church of the Godstar, the rival House Arakan that it deposed, local crimelords and even the Skygazers, those wandering mystics who claim to speak with the Godstar as they meditate whilst staring up at the blazing disc. They have paranormal powers.

Uses the Cepheus Engine rules, 70+ pages, well illustrated, with maps, factions, desert survival rules and gameplay advice. Use it as an alternate setting where personal shields have rendered guns obsolete and brought back duelling and sword combat OR use Godstar as a standard TL 13 world that can be dropped into any CE or Classic 2D6 SF subsector with ease.

"I am against my brother. My brother and I are against our cousin. My brother, my cousin and I are against our neighbours. All of us are against those who come from off-world."

- Utani Proverb

boardgame.name: Weird Contaminated World - Surplus Output 2020
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

2020 features six locations with encounter and loot ideas. None of this is “stat heavy”, and no maps are included. What you get is the idea, general description and the reference to the according page in the monster section of the Mutant Future core rule book (where appropriate).

boardgame.name: Waterdeep Walkabout
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Phandalin: Waterdeep Walkabout is the 9th adventure that started with New Phandalin A1: The Missing Miners and brings the heroes on a journey through Kryptgatden Forest and ends in the City of Waterdeep. Along the way, there is adventure and side quests in the forest, Goldenfields, Stump Bog, Rassalandar, and ends in Waterdeep.

boardgame.name: PotA Supplemental
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure centers around the small town of Red Larch...fire snakes start the adventure with a stranger elemental creature.

boardgame.name: The Knight of Samular
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This adventure follows the free adventure leading the PCs to find the body of the knight being brought to Summit Hall. Nothing is easy though and the PCs must stop an orc shaman from bringing the body to undeath.

boardgame.name: Summit Hall
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this adventure, the PCs bring the body of the deceased knight to its final resting place within the Hall. While interacting with the knights and the people of the small town that has sprung up around the keep, the PCs are asked to deal with a giant that has moved into a holy site once visited by the knights and pilgrims of Tyr.

boardgame.name: Beneath the Giant's Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this adventure, the PCs are asked by the high mage of Summit Hall to return to the monastery from the previous adventure and explore the catacombs beneath the hill. Here they will find clues from the lich Renwick's apprentice buried in the catacombs.

boardgame.name: Sacred Stone Monastery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This adventure [finds] the PCs heading to the Sacred Stone Monastery.

A multi-night adventure for 6-7th level characters.

boardgame.name: Cult Retribution
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This adventure is a side quest
...
The PCs find that the cultists have threatened the townsfolk and will return unless they deal with their temporary hideout.

boardgame.name: Temple of Eternal Flame
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This module provides monster statistics for each encounter in the Temple of Eternal Flame along with small modifications to treasure and monsters encountered. This is a 14 page module in an easy to read and print format that is designed for 9th level PCs.

boardgame.name: Findon's Mask
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Upon returning to town a group of dwarves seek them out to recover [ancient dwarven burial] masks. Trouble ensues when a group of giants follow the dwarves seeking retribution for an attack weeks before.

boardgame.name: Halls of the Hunting Axe
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This module [is about] the dwarf Gargosh and his quest to find the legendry axe Orcsplitter, followed by a rescue mission.

boardgame.name: Fane of the Eye
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Most of this adventure deals with providing the monster statistics for the encounters in Princes of the Apocalypse. There is some modifications and additional material not in the main published adventure.
...
A multi-night adventure for 11th level characters

boardgame.name: The Howling Caves
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this adventure, the PCs travel back through the Node to take on the air cult in The Howling Caves.

boardgame.name: The Plunging Torrents
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Plunging Torrents...follows Princes of the Apocalypse. There are some modified material and an expanded side quest, but the adventure mostly provides description and monster stats for the encounters found in the main adventure.

boardgame.name: Waterdeep: Iron Throne Hideout
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This adventure is designed to take place after Waterdeep: The Catacombs of Yintros. In this adventure, the PCs are asked to track down the adversaries from the last module. It is a revenge mission, but the nobles of Waterdeep are always looking after their business and the PCs are also tied in with a copper shortage and a mysterious set of bones from the jungles of Chult.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – Lando Calrissian
Star Wars: Legion – Lando Calrissian Commander Expansion
boardgame.description:
A smooth talking scoundrel and gambler, Lando Calrissian likes to keep his allegiance close to his chest. But when the chips are down and the galaxy is at stake, he sides with the freedom fighters of the Rebel Alliance. From captain of the Millennium Falcon to Administrator of Cloud City, no leadership role Calrissian has taken on is as important as Rebel general and he brings all this experience to the battles of Star Wars: Legion.

This expansion contains everything you need to add Lando Calrissian as a commander of your Rebel armies, beginning with a beautifully sculpted, unpainted hard plastic miniature that reflects Calrissian’s unique sense of style. Not only will you find three different options for his signature cape, you’ll also be able to choose between two facial expressions and whether or not Calrissian appears reaching for his X-8 Night Sniper Pistol in its holster or has it at the ready.

While the miniature gives Calrissian a unique presence on the battlefield, other components, like his unit card and three signature command cards, represent his history as a gambler and his tendency to take high stakes risks. Finally, Lando Calrissian isn’t one to enter a fight unprepared, and this expansion also includes six upgrade cards that give him access to the gear and training he needs to take on any challenge.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – Agent Kallus
Star Wars: Legion – Agent Kallus Commander Expansion
boardgame.description:
Feared both within and without the Imperial ranks, the Imperial Security Bureau scours the galaxy for any disloyal to the Empire. Agent Kallus is one of the ISB's most effective agents, using his cunning and combat prowess to snuff out the spark of rebellion at its source.

This expansion invites you to put this ruthless agent in command of your Imperial army, beginning with a highly customizable, unpainted hard plastic Agent Kallus miniature that reflects his status as a ruthless Imperial agent. In addition to choosing between two facial expressions for your miniature, you'll also be able to assemble your Agent Kallus with the trademark Imperial Security Bureau helmet or with no helmet at all. Finally, Agent Kallus is deadly up close and with a blaster and you can choose whether he appears with his signature J-19 Bo-Rifle in its blaster or staff forms.

While these features project Kallus' status as a relentless ISB agent, his unit card clearly outlines all of his abilities and his three signature command cards reflect his capacity to shape your strategy. Despite all of his skills, Kallus is still susceptible to sympathizing with his enemies, a weakness that is reflected in Flaw card included with this expansion. Finally, Agent Kallus carefully calculates what he'll need for each battle and seven upgrade cards invite you to choose the gear and training that best fits your battle plan.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: It's a Wonderful Kingdom
It's a Wonderful Kingdom: Legends
Království divů
Egy szép új királyság
Ein wundervolles Königreich
Ein wundervolles Königreich: Legenden
원더풀 킹덤
boardgame.description:
It's a Wonderful Kingdom is a standalone solo or 2-player game in a Low-Fantasy universe. Inspired by the core mechanics of its predecessor "It's a Wonderful World", this new game offers more interaction, a bluff mechanism and new challenges.

The game is played using modules, each different and offering mechanical twists. Each game, players will choose one of the different modules to compete against each other. The game is divided into 4 rounds. Each round having 3 phases.

Split & Trap
Players take turns placing their cards on two piles at the center of the table.
One player picks 2 cards from his hand and place it either on the same pile, or split it among the two piles. The other player chooses a pile. This step is repeated alternatively until the players have placed all the cards from their hands.
Furthermore, each player has 2 Trap tokens which can be used to place face down cards.

Planification
Each player chooses, for the cards he has collected, which ones to build and which ones to recycle in order to accelerate the development.

Sequential Production
Each player produces the resources of his Kingdom in a sequential way. The resources being produced in a certain order, it is necessary to anticipate the sequences to optimize the production and development.

At the end of the 4th round, the player with the most victory points wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Publisher Blurb

Issue #103 (December 2020): Accessible Documents

Each of the four quarterly issues may cover topics such as:

Advice for convention-goers, whether you have a disability or are just trying to be aware of others.
Guidance for how to accommodate people with disabilities in your games.
Advice for respectfully playing disabled characters.
First-looks and reviews of tabletop games with an emphasis on accessibility.
Tips on how to adapt certain game mechanics for various purposes.
Interviews with disabled game designers.
Important news and resources related to accessibility in gaming.
Art by disabled illustrators.
And more.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Confessions Of A Blind Game Designer
Reconciling Ableist Systems And Where To Go From Here
Vision Layers: Adding Accessibility To Your Layout

boardgame.name: Escape to Nowhere: Army Group South, December 1943-April 1944
boardgame.description:
"Escape to Nowhere: Army Group South, December 1943- April 1944" uses 16-mile hexes and army and corps units-of-maneuver to cover the liberation of the Ukraine and the Crimea by the Red Army at that time.

Designed by Ty Bomba using the same alternating-actions system as the earlier game "Codeword Thunderclap: Army Group Don, November 1942 – March 1943".

Published in Command Japan #156. December 2020.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Ambon: Burning Sun & Little Seagulls
boardgame.description:
"Ambon: Burning Sun & Little Seagulls" is a two player wargame simulating the battle of Ambon, that took place between 30th January and 3rd February 1942 in the island of Ambon, in the Moluccas. A Japanese force composed of the 228th Regiment of the 38th Division of the IJA and the 1st Kure Special Naval Landing Force occupied the island against a force composed of the Dutch Molukken Brigade and the Australian "Gull Force".

One player controls Japanese forces and the other one Allied (Dutch and Australian) forces. Victory is achieved by means of control of certain hexes and elimination of enemy units. The aim of the Japanese player is to conquer as soon as possible the three main key locations in Ambon (the city of Ambon, Paso, and the Laha airfield) as well as some secondary key locations. The sooner the Japanese conquers these locations, the more victory points he will receive. So, for the Japanese it's a race against the clock, while the Allied player must slow down the Japanese advance without suffering too many losses.

-description from designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Brand new ziplock game, with 2 sheets of diecut counters. I accept AUD and NZD cash/cheque/direct deposit/ money order/bank draft/ telegraphic transfer etc; and paypal in major currencies.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Star Wars – The Child Edition
boardgame.description: Imagine traveling around the galaxy with The Child, or affectionately known as "Baby Yoda" by fans. This Monopoly: Star Wars The Child edition board game features themes and artwork inspired by The Mandalorian live-action TV series on Disney Plus. Move around the gameboard as The Child, buy and sell Hideouts and Common Houses, and follow the actions on the Camtono cards and Bounty Puck cards. The last player remaining after everyone else has gone bankrupt wins the game!

boardgame.name: Across the Bug River: Volodymyr-Volynskyi 1941
boardgame.description:
Across the Bug River: Volodymyr-Volynskyi 1941 is an operational level simulation about the fighting during the first days of Operation Barbarossa in the Volodymyr-Volynskyi region.
The goal for the German player is to break through the Soviet defence lines and open the main road to the East.

Components of the game:

One rulebook
One map sheet
382 large counters of which 181 are combat units
Four player aid charts
Full color setup charts
Full color reinforcements charts
Two ten-sided dice



(from publisher's website)

It uses the same core system as VUCA's earlier "Crossing the Line".
