boardgame.name: The Seer's Sanctum
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Puzzle Dungeon: The Seers Sanctum is a system neutral adventure for characters of level 1 to 4.

When I first started running games, I was disappointed by the lack of cohesive puzzles in adventures that I found. The ones with puzzles usually didn’t feel like they belonged in the adventure or they weren’t of the design caliber that I was used to coming from the classic Legend of Zelda games.

I wanted dungeons where each location has its own mysteries that the players have to unravel as they can poke around and experiment with their environment and the equipment they find.

Where not everything makes sense at first, but as they come back and explore previous areas with acquired knowledge and magic items, the pieces start to come together and they’ll be able to unlock the main puzzle of the dungeon.

boardgame.name: Everest 1924
boardgame.description:
This is a solo game of determination against increasingly demanding odds. You will attempt to ascend Mount Everest by rolling and manipulating dice to try and beat increasingly challenging scores. Playing the game is easy - succeeding is not.

All you need to play is a copy of the game sheet, pen/pencil and six D6. Game time will be around 15 minutes.

In June 1924, George Mallory and Andrew Irvine began their ascent to the peak of Mount Everest, hoping to be first to ever do so. It was to be a journey from which neither man would return alive, and whether or not they were successful remains a mystery to this day. When asked why he was planning to undertake such a dangerous and gruelling endeavour Mallory had replied simply “because it’s there”.

boardgame.name: ヒ秘 (Baboons)
boardgame.description:
ヒ秘 (Baboons) is a memory game from Japan, with players leading their troops of baboons across the Savannah. In Japanaese ヒ秘 means 'secret'.

The Savannah is a 4*4 tableau of face-down tiles, which might be food or water, or hazards such as cobras, leopards, or rival baboons. The players start their baboon leader in a corner and move up to three spaces. After looking at a face-down tile, a player can mark it, and must remember what the marking was for.

Each player has a small board showing the size and health of their troop. The players are trying to get their troop to be the largest by the end of the game.

During the game, a player might turn up a sunset, which ends the round. The game ends on a fifth sunset.

There are also wildfires on the Savannah, and these cause tiles to be replaced. Players must contend with their own memories and changes to the tableau.

boardgame.name: An Unpleasant and Devastating Fight: The Battle For the Sittang Bridge February 21-22, 1942
boardgame.description:
“We arrived at Mokpalin, from the south…There were masses of troops but no staffs… We were at the south of the railway station but west of the line, and throughout the day the Japs were attacking on the other side of the line… After a bit the Kawkareik Brigadier turned up… and really did get things organized. We were very glad to see him. We were to form a box round Mokpalin, we being in the S.W. corner.” –Officer of the 8th Burma Rifles about the battle for the Sittang Bridge.

The situation for the Allies in Burma was increasingly desperate following the Japanese invasion that began in December 1941. After nearly a month of fighting the British Dominion forces were in full retreat, hoping to meet with reinforcements being rushed to the theater and to regroup behind the Sittang River. Key to this goal was the successful withdrawal of the Indian 17th Division. That division had been engaged in a running fight with the Japanese 33rd (214th and 215th Regiments) and 55th (143rd Regiment) Divisions from the outset of the invasion. Both sides converged on the only major bridge over the Sittang river north of Rangoon, a railway span near the town of Sittang. An Allied success here could potentially thwart the Japanese offensive and save Rangoon. Another victory for the Japanese could lead to the capture of that major port and even more conquests by the sons from the land of the Rising Sun.

Each copy of An Unpleasant and Devastating Fight is composed of the following:

One 11 by 17 inch hex map
One sheet of 70 double-sided, unmounted counters
8 pages of rules

Infantry units are battalions, all other units are companies. A hex is approximately 800 yards across. Each turn represents six hours of time. Players will need a standard deck of playing cards and a six-sided die to play the game. A custom card set that replaces the standard deck of playing cards is also available.

An Unpleasant and Devastating Fight is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Ilya Kudriashov.

-description from designer

listing.notes:
For sale is a brand new copy of An Unpleasant and Devastating Fight by the publisher and designer.
Mounted counters can be had for an additional $8.00.
A card set for the game, that replaces the standard deck of playing cards called for in the rules, is also available for an additional $10.00.
Paypal gladly accepted. Check or money order only accepted from domestic USA customer.

boardgame.name: St. Augustine-opoly
boardgame.description:
St. Augustine-opoly is a version of the game Monopoly about the city of St. Augustine

In this roll-and-move property trading game, properties are St Augustine favorite locations such as: Alligator Farm, Castillo de San Marcos, The Fountain of Youth, and of course, the St. Augustine Lighthouse...

Players pay money when they land on each other's properties, and the goal is to bankrupt your opponents.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company

boardgame.name: Domesday (COIN)
boardgame.description:
Domesday is a board game that adapts the COIN Series developed by GMT Games to the Norman Conquest of England. Players control the Norman, Saxon, Viking, and Scots/Welsh Factions and use Events, Commands and Special Abilities to place and move leaders and pieces on the map to control areas, gain support, and win victory.

Edward the Confessor returned from exile in Normandy after decades of Viking rule in 1042 to become king of England. Magnus the Good of Norway also claimed the throne, and threatened war, but was dissuaded by the childless Edward, who promised to make him his heir. Edward gave the same promise to Sweyn Estridsson of Denmark, William of Normandy, and Harold Godwinson. When he died in 1066 four powerful warlords claimed to be his rightful heir. It would not end well.

Cards are drawn from the deck one at time, with one card in play and the following card face up on top of the deck. Each Event card shows the order in which Eligible Factions may choose to resolve the Event or one of their own Commands, sometimes with one of their Special Abilities. Resolving an Event or Command makes the Faction Ineligible for the next card. Crown Events interrupt play as a King is crowned, Victory is determined, Revenue is collected, and Support is expanded.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Collapse!
boardgame.description: Collapse! is a scenario for Next War: Korea included with C3i #27 that features streamlined air combat and an updated sequence of play on four pages and two double-sided play aids.

boardgame.name: 1914: Twilight in the East – Dragoni Variant
boardgame.description:
Hypothetical variant for "Dragoni's plan for Austro-Hungarian victory in 1914".

4 page set-up folder, 2 page rules changes and designer's notes in the magazine, 140 counters.

Included with C3i magazine #26

listing.notes: I live in Madrid, very near the international airport ;). Accept payment by PayPal, Bank Transfer, TransferWise, Cash on hand and i consider other online payment services.

boardgame.name: American Revolution Tri-pack: Solitaire Tactics Methods
Battles of the American Revolution: Solitaire Tactics Methods
boardgame.description:
Table play aid and rules for resolving Close Combat in the Battles of the American Revolution series when playing solitaire.

Regular PvP play has battle tactics determined in a secret selection of tactics by each player; this doesn't work for solitaire play. This accessory provides a methodology in lieu of that method.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Battles of the American Revolution (GMT)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Battles of the American Revolution Tri-pack: Guilford, Saratoga, Brandywine

boardgame.name: God Loves, Man Kills
boardgame.description:
Author's description:

A former wizards tower in the small coastal town of Torn fell into disrepair some years ago, and was taken over by the Church Of Lathander, who converted it into a Lighthouse and private cloister for scholars of the church. Lead by the esteemed Father Ephesian, The Windwatcher Lighthouse aided growth in the small village and provided excellent spiritual training for acolytes. However, things took a sinister turn as reports came to the Church of the Lighthouse being closed off, the Light diminishing and a violent wind whipping around the structure to keep people away. Once eye witness reports from the village were received by the Church of the corpse of a murdered acolyte washing up to shore, and no response from Father Ephesian, the Church has become suspicious. What could drive an esteemed teacher to murder? To disregard his God and Church? To become a potentially deadly problem for the village of Torn? They must send a team to investigate...

boardgame.name: Fresh Bones
boardgame.description:
Author's Description:

Three hearty and loyal soldiers have apparently committed suicide in as many weeks - all three stationed at the temporary refugee camp “Sierra Forward Base”. The soldiers have been garrisoned for a month and a half to take care of Dusk Elf refugees fleeing their homeland following a natural disaster… but with antagonistic guards, a beaten down and frustrated populace and the strong belief in the supernatural among the refugees, things are not all as they seem. What mysteries are hidden in the Sierra Forward Base, and what can explain the deaths of these loyal soldiers? Can the issues be resolved before there are more losses of life, or worse another full scale riot?

boardgame.name: Great Rolled Ones
boardgame.description:
"You and the other players are cultists attempting to summon Cthulhu and bring about the end of the world. YOu must successfully perform 50 arcane rituals, but be careful: misspeak the the strange incantations and you will suffer Cthulu's wrath!"

This is a push your luck game of dice rolling to complete rituals. Completed rituals within a run score you points, provided that you don't accumulate three 1's causing you to go insane and score nothing for the run.

You'll need paper and pencil to keep track of the score.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Bouquet
boardgame.description:
"You and the other players are floral designers, and the most popular bouquets this season incorporate a wide variety of flowers. In this game, each value on a die represents a different flower... and only the most diverse arrangements will sell for top dollar!"

This is a dice rolling game where you are locking in values, deciding if you will stop & score the locked values or continue to pushing your luck and re-roll. You bust and score nothing if you only roll locked values on the next roll. If you stopped and scored you get points; the game ends when you get to 100 points.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Flick of Faith: Santa God Promo
Palec Boży: Święty Mikołaj – karta promo
boardgame.description:
Snow and presents!
Santa can use Prophets and Temples of any other god currently not in the game.
Ho, ho, ho! Instead of building Temple put 3VP token on the map. You get that VP as soon as it leaves the City you put it into.

This promo was created to celebrate the Christmas of 2020.

-description from designer

listing.notes: Spain or Portugal + shiping
+ Veles + Loki

boardgame.name: Swapportunity
boardgame.description:
"Each player is trying to beat the dealer in this game of dice-swapping, but if you aren't careful you might put yourself in trouble on a later turn!"

Using 3 dice, you play a game of swapping dice to beat the dealer's pair of dice. You get 3 choices - use the dice you rolled, swap a die with your locked die to improve your score, or use all 3 dice. This results in you locking one die to a 1 for the next round.

If you beat the dealer, you get a point. First one to 6 points wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Little Fish
boardgame.description:
"You and the other players are little fish, trying to avoid the fisherman! At the end of the round, the biggest fish get caught, and only the little fish survive. Compete in secret for the highest score, but when your results are revealed each round, the best dice on the table get tossed out."

Secretively roll your dice up to three times and try and get the most points scored with any dice not caught. The highest number on the table is caught and doesn't score.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Street Fighter: The Storytelling Game 20th Anniversary Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now there’s an old way to play Street Fighter!

Finally, after twenty years, the groundbreaking Street Fighter: The Storytelling Game returns to bring the action back! Join in as the World Warriors pit their mystical martial arts abilities against the evil crime empire of Shadoloo. Create your own Street Fighter, choose your own special powers, and carve your own legend among the ranks of the Street Fighters.

This book compiles all of the rules, styles, maneuvers and other materials released for Street Fighter: The Storytelling Game across all six game books released during its original run. Errata and clarifications have been added so you can get straight to the butt-kicking action without delay! Prepare to once again explore a high-action world of adventure and danger, to visit exotic locations around the world, and fight for what you believe in!

With Street Fighter: The Storytelling Game’s 20th Anniversary edition, Street Fighter will never die!

Face it straight! Go for broke!

boardgame.name: Sink or Swim
boardgame.description:
"If we're going down, we're going down together! IN this game of doublethink, everyone contributes dice to the center, then competes for them. Use the same tactics as another player, however, you will sink!"

This simultaneous play has you rolling two dice and putting them into a pool in the center. Then you secretly set a die to what you think you want to pull from the center with each matching die equating to a point. The problem is you lose points for each matching die when another person also sets their die to that value. Set it to a value that isn't in the pool and neither gain or lose points. After 10 rounds, see who has the most points!

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Frenemies
boardgame.description:
"You and your opponent are reluctant partners. Work alongside your enemy to determine the winning condition, then try to take them out!"

In this 2 player game you secretly choose a die from those that you rolled to contribute to the center. These set your winning conditions to trying to beat this pot's value with your remaining dice, equaling the value, or being lower. If you can meet the conditions you win the round! Win 5 rounds and you in the game...

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: The G-File
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

My main goal for this site was to add all the new video game characters to Street Fighter: The Storytelling Game, because many of them had been released after this game went out of print.

There have been many starts and stops, sometimes I would include or exclude different games, other times I might scrap the whole project and start over because I wasn’t happy with it.

This however, is the final version! Bear with me as I complete it. It will include write-ups for the Characters/Styles/Maneuvers of Alpha, One, Three, Four, and Five (The EX series is no longer included as I have learned it is not canon).

boardgame.name: Navidad Pass
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This year's Christmas offering sends the party into a canyon to rescue an Elf who has been attacked while on his way to deliver gifts to a nearby town. Sure his name is Claus and he wears red but c'mon...it isn't 'that' campy! Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays everyone!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a trio of adventurers (3rd level) and a DM.

boardgame.name: Villains of Firstdawn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“In another world, she may have been a hero. But fate gives and takes in equal measure, and so our tale is instead of one who was shaped to walk a darker path.”
- Sage Malden Hull, Epics of Firstdawn, Volume 1.

Firstdawn is the celebration of the Aeonian Spirit, the raw creative energy that winds its way through every facet of the Prime Material and rests as a small spark within every being. It’s about honoring those heroes who have ignited that spark and grown its power through accomplishing extraordinary deeds and facing seemingly insurmountable odds. Firstdawn, above all else, is hope. Hope that there are those out there who would risk themselves for the greater good and stand against evil, but also hope that anyone can become those heroes. The Aeonian Spirit is in all things, after all. Which means that even the most humble goat herder or blacksmith’s child can rise up to protect themselves or those they love against the trials that the world provides.

But that also means that spark can be found in darker souls. And like all things, the Aeonian Spirit is a force of balance. For every light a shadow. For every virtue a vice. And for every hero a villain.

This supplement includes:

3 new threats perfect for your icy campaigns and winter celebrations.
Frostbiter, a CR 6 elemental.
Mice Imps, CR 1/4 fey.
Ralhl Gwyr, a CR 8 trollkin.

A new icy cantrip.
The legendary artifact, Garulka’s Fury.
Plot hooks you can use to introduce these villains of Firstdawn to your party of heroes.

boardgame.name: Firstdawn: The Festival of Spirit
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“On this day of Firstdawn, I feel my heart jump at the thought of the songs, the celebrations, of the fellowship that we become a part of! Children run to and fro under the glow of the star crystals, darting from decorated houses to hang painted grables on trees outside. Families gather by the hearth between festivities, making gifts and preparing for feasts. In all of our actions, we celebrate the gods and heroes who have led us to this new year. Truly we capture the spirit of the first day!”

— Maliim Remoure, Poet of High Lirren

Firstdawn is a festival celebrating the coming of the new year and the good of the Aeonian Spirit, the raw energy of creation that flows throughout the universe and energizes the beings of the Prime Material. It’s a day to celebrate the heroes who have taken that spark from the Aeonian Spirit and turned it into something grand. And it is a day to honor those gods who have blessed the people and kept the realms safe for mortals.

This supplement includes:

Information on Firstdawn, the festival of spirit.
Seasonal trade goods.
Plot hooks to push your players toward heroic deeds.

boardgame.name: The Lady in the Shoe
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An evil noble lady with magic powers has polymorphed Schuhdorf's leaders into goats and stolen them before flying off in her giant shoe. Later that night, eerie singing from the woods lured away several of the village's children. Can the heroes track the children and rescue them from the lady in the shoe? This 5E D&D adventure for five 2nd-level characters includes details about how to scale the dangers for weaker or stronger parties.

boardgame.name: Cult of Sekhmet
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mystery cults are secret societies that exist within religious institutions. Like other secret societies, their existence is well known, but their rituals, lore, and objectives are concealed. Only the initiated are allowed access to these secrets.

This file provides an overview of mystery cults and specific details about the Cult of Sekhmet, Egypt's bloodthirsty war goddess.

Features:

Sample cult secrets
The location of Sekhmet's major temples
The Day of Destruction and other festivals held in Sekhmet's honor
The guardian statues of Sekhmet
A new spell, Sun Ray


The Oath of Blood and Fire which Sekhmet's paladins take.
If you are playing an Amazons Vs Valkyries campaign, this cult is essential. If you are playing another fantasy campaign with a leonine war goddess, you should still check this out! And if your fantasy campaign setting doesn't have a leonine war goddess, it should!

boardgame.name: The Marvelous City: A Guide to 1930s Rio
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Cidade Maravilhosa!

Rio de Janeiro — “The Marvelous City”. A tropical get-away from the rest of the world. A place of music and dance, jungled mountains and pristine white beaches. A place where Catholicism mixes uneasily with African animism and magic, where slickly-dressed con artists roam the streets and capoeira gangs fights for their turf.

The Marvelous City is a 90 page guide to a pulp action 1930s Rio for the Ubiquity role playing system. It includes an overview of the city and its culture, as well as new rules for capoeira and for “macumba”, and an adventure set in Rio.

boardgame.name: Fey Mystic Connections
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mysteries of the Celestial Fey

Get new options for your mystic to commune with the fey spirits of the universe that inhabit the shadowy realms that parallel the physical reality of the Material Plane. Dialogue with the immortal fey with the evermorn connection or manipulate the flow of eternity with the time connection, with over a dozen connection abilities like fey-touched mien, evermorn visionary, temporal shudder,and tear reality!

boardgame.name: Metahuman Uprising
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Imagine a world much like our own, except that super-powered “metahumans” live among us, and always have—Zeus was simply a metahuman who controlled electricity, Hercules was another who had preternatural strength, Ra could absorb and project energy from the sun, and so on.

For a long time, metahumans were few in number and consigned to the annals of mythology. But in recent years, their numbers have exploded, and they can no longer hide their existence. Humanity has reacted with fear and confusion, leading to escalating tensions and violent confrontations.

You are metahuman heroes who have chosen to protect society from supervillains and other threats, using your powers for good—while taking care not to reveal your real identities.”

Inspired by popular superhero movies and TV shows, Metahuman Uprising is a standalone scenario for the Tricube Tales system and is usable as a micro-setting, but it is also a fully self-contained one-page RPG in its own right. You can print it on a single sheet of paper: The first page includes everything you need to play, while an optional second page expands the adventure generator with examples and twists. The PDF uses layers for ease of printing.

boardgame.name: The Trolls
boardgame.description:
From Inroduction:

Just as humans may grow into giants when sustained upon a diet of arcane forces — or perhaps just a superhuman excess of spite and greed — so too can the goblinoid peoples become trolls. Such power is needed to live in the wilderness alone, or near enough, and those who stay civilized may become many things, but a troll is not one of them. It is the solitude that makes them what they are: fey creatures of the wild earth, a breed of magical megafauna who walk between worlds.

In the Sakhab Wastes, a troll may become a law unto itself. And a small gang of trolls can pretty much have the run of the place, whatever place it is they want to run. What army of orcs would rather test their steel against such brutes when there are soft men upon the plains for them to slaughter? And goblins unwise enough to pick a fight with anything more than double their own size will fi nd they don’t get to pick very many fights at all.

boardgame.name: Superzings: Rivals of Kaboom
boardgame.description: Roll the battle dice and determine your battle power. The highest battle power score wins the clash! Compete and defeat five times to win the game! Contents: Double-sided game board, 4 character playing pieces and stands, 4 character battle power cards, 1 unique enigma figure, 1 battle dice and instructions.

boardgame.name: Malpractice
boardgame.description:
"You and other players are all doctors of questionable skills and ethics. Score points when your patients survive, and when they don't. Will you be a hero, a monster, or both?"

You have two dice patients you are caring for... Roll their values and you can improve their health. Doubles and triples allow even more health improvement. Those you can't tend to have their health erode. If the patient die rises above six the patient scores for you and a new patient die comes in. If a die's health erodes below 1, they die and likewise get replaced.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Dragon Braggin'
boardgame.description:
"You and other players are in a tavern, boasting about who can kill the biggest dragon without getting burned. Careful, though... your opponent can chicken out and make you face the dragon instead|"

This two player game has you going back and forth deciding to take on the dragon by rolling your three dice or chickening out and forcing your opponent to roll against the dragon. Score points for beating the dragon or when your opponent loses. First to 5 points wins!

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Fnord Dice
boardgame.description:
"'Everything in the universe relates to five, one way or another, given enough ingenuity on the part of the interpreter.'

- The Law of Fives, Principia Discordia"

This is played in rounds where rolling matching triples on 5 dice score points along with other matching numbers. Each player takes a turn within the round rolling and scoring. Whenever 50 points is reached the round is finished so everyone gets an equal turn and the player with the highest score wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Yea or Nay
boardgame.description:
"You and other players are trying to fool the dealer in this game of truth and deception. A successful bluff scores you a point, but if the dealer can see through your nonsense, they get a point instead."

The dealer rolls two dice in the open. Everyone else keeps their roll secret. Using a combination of what looks to be derived from roman voting and the dealer declaring whether there is belief or not in the declaration, points are scored. After two rounds the games ends and the winner is the one that earned the most points.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Six-Sided Slayers
boardgame.description:
"In this cooperative game, you and other players take on classic adventurer roles and charge deep into the monster's lair. Kill enough monsters and become legendary heroes! Fail too often and you become a cautionary tale..."

Each player has six dice while the rest are the dice pool representing the monster. Low valued dice are not a part of the monster. Players decide and declare what role they will be - bard, wizard, warrior, etc. Then they roll their dice. They then remove monster dice if they can match the dice per their role's abilities. If they defeat the monster (i.e. the monster has no more dice), the group earns a point. If there are dice remaining though, the monster deals one point damage per die remaining. If the group can get 5 points before they get 5 damage points, they win. If neither of these have been hit, take another round. If the party ever gets 5 points of damage though - well, the tales told in the taverns won't be happy ones...

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: The Dr. Seuss 4-Game Treasury
boardgame.description:
This big game treasury contains all you need to play four fun Dr. Seuss games based on his well-known books: Cat in the Hat Game, Green Eggs and Ham Game, Dr. Seuss's ABC Game, and One fish, two fish, red fish, go fish! Card Game.
Each captures Seuss's whimsical style, memorable characters, and unique sense of humor, while teaching important early reading concepts like letter-recognition, rhyming, and word association.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Marvel Heroes: Power Play! – Electronic Game Book
boardgame.description:
Join Marvel Heroes as they battle a battery of bad guys bent on taking over the world!
If you're game, then Marvel Heroes Power Play Electronic Game Book is for you! Inside, you'll find five exciting board games that put you right in the middle of the action and make you a member of the Marvel Heroes team. Just pick your Super Hero play pieces and get ready to help Spider-Man, the Fantastic Four, X-men, Avengers, and the Hulk defeat their foes.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fields of Battle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Line up the troops and get ready to rumble with "Fields of Battle," a digital file. Crisply defined lines and vibrant colors show an unforgiving, rocky ground underfoot that could play havoc with tactical maneuvers, while green vegetation provides cover - or does it give the enemy a place to hide? "Fields of Battle" is a versatile gaming mat that can visually accommodate a variety of imaginative surroundings, enhancing game play wherever your adventure takes you.

boardgame.name: Scrubland
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Have you been looking for something to elevate your game experience? “Scrubland,” a digital file, may be just what the doctor ordered. This image contains defined texture and a variegated landscape, creating a realistic backdrop for your battle or adventure. Its red-grey color scheme sets the tone for a wide but nuanced range of scenarios; this isn’t a happy field where elves dilly-dally and battles are fought in the clear light of day. It’s a flatland alongside a volcano. An open expanse of danger on the cold Martian landscape. Or maybe just the edge of a forest where the trees have run to bushy, scrubby undergrowth, and everything seems run-of-the-mill…..but it definitely isn’t.

boardgame.name: Wasteland
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In your quest to achieve gaming greatness, we at Terrainify are here for you, and so is “Wasteland,” a digital file. Do you need a high quality product to impress your friends - but at a budget-friendly price? “Wasteland” fits the bill - and your budget. Did Greg left a water ring on your gaming table again (seriously, Greg, again?) and you’re tired of working around “the white circles of mystery” in your gameplay and want to cover them with a more playable landscape? The dynamic contouring and coloring of “Wasteland” fits a wide range of gaming scenarios. Is your OCD kicking in, and you want a game mat that not only looks thematically appropriate for your battle or adventure, but also has pristine, crisp image quality? “Wasteland” looks fabulous from a distance of a few yards or a few inches; you’ll be able to see the texture of the ground beneath your miniatures’ feet. Is there anything more you could want from a gaming mat? (Well...we tried to get it to put all the pieces away at the end of the game, but without opposable thumbs, it was a no-go.)

boardgame.name: The Quacks of Quedlinburg: Ingredient Cases
boardgame.description:
Base game:
219 cases in the appropriate colors for the ingredients pumpkin, mandrake, garden spider, toadstool, crows skull, african death’s head hawkmoth, ghost’s breath and cherry bomb.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Quacks of Quedlinburg: Big Box

boardgame.name: Star Arena
boardgame.description:
StarArena is an action-packed Who-Gets-To-The-Top-First_Wins!! and the physical Battle-Arena (Board-Game) to the gratuitous web-published CCG (Card-Game). What might look like a unadventurous roll, spin and move board-game on the surface, is actually an instant timeless classic due to the multiple-levels that rotate around a game-axle. This 'game-mechanic' alters the Arena-Area and Battle-Conditions, therewith things can go from Bad to Worse in an instance while the Game-Gods favor the current player, ...or not!?

The StarArena_Board-Game follows the Rules-Of-Conduct, these Area-Rules are printed on the back of the board so that they may never-get-lost! After it is decided who starts the game by 'Jan-Ken-Pon; A Game-Turn is always started by the roll of the dice! The D8 outcome gives you the amount of 'Actions' you may perform during your turn, divided into 'Turning' and/or 'Moving!'

If the Game-Gods favor you? You can use the larger number of actions gained, to turn the game board into 'Color-Advantage' and 'Level-Up' towards the Top from 'Own-Color-To-Color' without having to do: Card-Battle. If your actions are limited; You should consider spending them on forcing the next-player into Card-Combat? Since the rule is: to Enter the game _from base 'into' the arena_ you must Insert-Coin onto the top-square of the game-board named 'Sanctuary; The first player to reach the top in Card-Battle takes home the Treasure!'

Knocking other players off the game-board back-to-base in card-combat, makes them have to Re-Enter the game and Insert-Coin again, thickening the plot and pot. Thus-far the focus has been on the ROC, the surefire way to Level-Up is; Win in Card-Battle! When you boldly claim a battle with another player, your actions are paused and the Rules-Of-Engagement are set into effect. Win your battle: You may continue your Actions +1 Level-Up! If you fail to be victorious, you loose your actions, your turn ends and your Hero remains on the last location, which could prove precarious in the next-players turn...

It is a deceptively simple game and you have to make the best of each situation, the aim of the game is: Reach Sanctuary First! Just remember; You are not the only one in the Arena with the eyes on the Prize!?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Runner-Up
boardgame.description:
"Charge to the finish line right behind the player in first, but don't get eliminated by the player in third! Second place wins all!"

This dice rolling game has you comparing dice that you roll and select each round, if you match other players then you don't score. If you wind up in second place you do! Game ends as soon as someone has collected 6 points.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Cavern at the Obelisk
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Cavern at the Obelisk is a Scarred Lands adventure for 4-6 characters of levels 4-6, set in the northern continent of Fenrilik.

At the eastern village of Vorudislav, the adventurers are commissioned by a local logger who was expecting a shipment of wollahogs from the Ivanov farm, a day’s journey to the north west. As the adventurers head toward out in the direction of the farm, they discover a terrible fate that befell Jonas Ivanov and his hogs...and a sleeping threat to the people of Vorudislav.

Cavern at the Obelisk includes:

A complete adventure set in the logging vilage of Vorudislav.
Six reeady-made characters, included in the module pages and presented as editable pdfs.
Maps for print-and-play, or VTT
An art-free version of the indesign files for community creator use and reference.
The Ready-Made Characters included in this adventure are presented on the Frostlands of Fenrilik Character Sheet by Benjamin L. Eastman and Matt Dunn.
The Cold Domain Cleric is presented in Voices of the Snow - Character Options by Joe Raso
The Fenrilik Oozes featured in this adventure first appeared in Curious Creatures of the Frostlands by Chad Lensch.

boardgame.name: No Quarter
boardgame.description:
"You are captain of a well armed ship, caught in a broadside battle against an enemy vessel captained by your opponent. As you race forward, you fire at the other ship and bark orders at your crew!"

Each round you will secretly rearrange your weakest and strongest areas amongst 3 different zones of your ship. Then you will declare what part of your opponent's ship you are targeting and roll dice. Did you get a hit? They adjust the amount of damage downwards. Did you miss entirely, then you adjust downwards. If a section of a ship goes below 1, then the ship sinks.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Avalon (Issue 8 - May/Jun 1993)
boardgame.description:
Das Vulkanvolk; a location by Christel Scheja (system-agnostic)
Ol' Man River (Bad Moon Rising), a Cthulhu scenario by D.G.DiDi
and various shorter pieces
boardgame.rpgissue: Ravenhorst - Das große Fanzine für alle Fantasy-Rollenspiele

boardgame.name: Poule Poule: Oka Luda Goose Card
boardgame.description:
Add the card to the animal deck.
When the Oka Luda Goose card comes into play, the foxes brood the eggs and the chicken hunt the foxes. All other animals actions remain the same.

Promo card found in Plato Magzine 129

boardgame.name: ito
命悬一线
boardgame.description:
Each player then gets a set of number cards and the aim is to cooperate and play the card in ascending order.

Players can discuss and provide hints to others by suggesting an object based on the topic drawn. (e.g. The best Japanese cuisine, the higher the number the more popular the dish is.)

boardgame.name: Skeet
boardgame.description:
"Blast the most targets in this silly dexterity game and win!"

This is a dice flicking game aimed at collecting cards. Whoever claims the most cards when the draw deck runs out, wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Deadly Dig
boardgame.description:
"You and the other players are all treasure hunters, exploring a dark and deadly crypt. Each step into the crypt will be more valuable, but also more dangerous!"

This is a six round game to attempt to get treasure. You choose whether to continue or not gaining treasure along the way. If you choose to go back (or get through 6 turns of rolling winning each time), you score the dice you collected. If you get chased back, you lose all the treasure that round.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Hexican Train
boardgame.description:
"In this dice-based twist on a classic dominoes game, players use pairs of dice to create a long train. Get stuck with dice at the end, however, and your game will derail quickly!"

You have a dice 'bone pile' that you play from adding to the dealer's lead pair, treating the dice pair as a domino. Each person in turn tries to connect a pair or pass, when everyone passes the round is over and remaining dice score against you. Once someone gets to 10 points the winner is determined.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Animal Marche
アニマルシェ
boardgame.description:
Fountain square located in the center of the city.
The player is the owner of the shop facing the square.
Let's attract as many customers as possible, earn income, and further develop the store!

The main flow of the game is to call in the customer in front of your store. When everyone calls in, you will get coins and wood according to the number of customers. Then you can use your employees to build or renovate your store.

After 5 rounds, and the player with the most points wins. Scores can be earned by achieving the personal goal card, constructing public buildings, and etc.

boardgame.name: Three-Legged Race
boardgame.description:
"Maintain a careful balance as you chase three high scores at once!"

This one is a bit of a math at the end where you are trying to optimize the summed difference of scores to be the closest to 50 across three scoring columns. Each person is working to do this.

The game can be played in turns or simultaneous.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: SSB3DS/WiiU Fighter Bundle
Super Smash Bros. for 3DS/Wii U - Fighters
boardgame.description:
Includes the following DLC fighters:

Bayonetta
Corrin
Cloud
Ryu
Roy
Lucas
Mewtwo
boardgame.videogameexpansion: Super Smash Bros. for Nintendo 3DS and Wii U

boardgame.name: Infinity Gauntlet: A Love Letter Game – Foil Infinity Stones Cards
boardgame.description: Deck out your deck with 6 foil infinity stones!
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Infinity Gauntlet: A Love Letter Game

boardgame.name: SSB3DS/WiiU Stage Bundle
Super Smash Bros. for 3DS/Wii U - Stage Bundle
boardgame.description:
Contains the Following DLC stages:
Super Mario Maker
Peach's Castle (64)
Hyrule Castle (64)
Dream Land (64)
Pirate Ship (Wii U only)
Umbra Clock Tower
Midgar
Suzaku Castle
boardgame.videogameexpansion: Super Smash Bros. for Nintendo 3DS and Wii U

boardgame.name: Backhand
boardgame.description:
"Serve! Volley! Lob! Smash! Roll Dice to simulate hitting a tennis ball back and forth, sometimes spending more energy to make powerful shots."

This has you trying to win a set as in tennis and deciding whether you want to use a power shot or not. The power shot uses up a limited supply of energy (tracked on one die) to roll an extra die for sending a shot in...

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Bluey: Shadowlands Board Game
boardgame.description:
Bluey is a loveable, six-year-old Blue Heeler dog, who loves to turn everyday family life into endless, playful adventures. She loves to create and play unique games with her family and friends. Play a game of "Shadowlands" with Bluey and her friends. Stay in the shadowy bits, collect 5 Cupcake Cards and be the first to the picnic! Turn the palm tree in the center of the board to change the shadowy bits as you play! This fun and unpredictable board game is great for children aged 3 and up!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Unreliable Flying Object
boardgame.description:
"You and the other players are members of the same spaceship crew, trying to return home. Your ship is pretty battered from the last mission, and things are constantly breaking, risking the lives of everyone aboard. Can you work together as a team to keep the ship flying, or will you die in space?"

Different parts of the ship have different durabilities. You will be rolling to prevent these durabilities from decreasing to zero, which will destroy the ship. If you can make it the number of required rounds without this happening, then you successfully got home.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: The Devil to Play
boardgame.description:
"Alas Poor Convict, I Knew Him Well … 'Tis a Shame He Fell Prey to the Sydney Devil"

One of the more surprising elements of the early penal settlements of Australia is the convict theatre. When one thinks of a brutal and isolated settlement filled with the most desperate and degenerate, playhouses and performances don't readily spring to mind. And yet there was a convict theatre at Sydney almost from the time of the colony's founding … and ironically its success was almost its downfall, since numerous instances were reported where thieves targetted houses of individuals they knew would be out watching the latest convict play.

Ticket of Leave #16 is our largest supplement to-date for Convicts & Cthulhu. It looks at the phenomenon of convict theatre in the early settlement, and provides a detailed depiction of the foremost theatre of the day.

In addition to offering historical source material, this supplement also includes a lengthy scenario which is designed to provide a challenging mystery suitable to experienced players of Investigative Lovecraft games. A series of unusually ravaged bodies have been turning up on the streets of Sydney … and the only apparent link between the victims is that they had all recently attended Sidaway's convict theatre. Could it be that some deranged killer is targetting theatre-goers? But why does this ne'er-do-well dismember and partially devour those he kills? Or is there something more sinister at the theatre, perhaps even something to do with their next play — a s
urrilous piece called "The Devil To Pay"?

Can the investigators uncover the cause of the terrible slayings before the murderer strikes again? Can they stave off the rising tide of voices that wants the convict theatre closed down altogether? But most importantly can they uncover just what payment the Sydney Devil truly desires …?

boardgame.name: Ravenhorst (Issue 17 - Nov 2000)
boardgame.description: contains two scenarios for DSA and one for Cthulhu, and some articles/reviews.
boardgame.rpgissue: Ravenhorst - Das große Fanzine für alle Fantasy-Rollenspiele

boardgame.name: Ravenhorst (Issue 18 - Jul 2001)
boardgame.description:
The final issue of this fanzine (a #19 is announced, but was never realized) contains a DSA scenario set in Myranor, a Cthulhu scenario, and some articles and reviews.

The issue came with loose handouts for the Cthulhu scenario.
boardgame.rpgissue: Ravenhorst - Das große Fanzine für alle Fantasy-Rollenspiele

boardgame.name: 30 Monedas
boardgame.description:
Father Vergara is an exorcist, boxer and ex convict, who has been exiled by the Vatican to a remote village of Spain. This tranquil little village does not know what has hit it when it begins to experience a series of inexplicable paranormal phenomena, and it won’t take long for the villagers to realise the new parish priest is somehow involved. Paco, the naive Mayor and Elena, a restless vet, will try to unveil the secrets of the priest’s past and the significance of the old coin that Vergara has in his possession. Little by little, this unusual trio will find themselves immersed in a global conspiracy: the battle for control of the thirty coins paid to the apostle Judas Iscariot for betraying Jesus Christ.

In 30 Coins you will put yourself in the shoes of the three main characters, Father Vergara, the Mayor Paco and the veterinary surgeon Elena. You will need to investigate the paranormal events which are occurring in the village, confront another world and try to sabotage the plans devised by the forces of evil. You will achieve your goal if you complete the missions which are presented to you at the beginning of each chapter and at the same time you must avoid The Cainites getting hold of the Coin you possess. Should you fail and they manage to get their hands on the last Coin of Judas, the consequences will be devastating for all humanity.


El padre Vergara, un exorcista, boxeador y exconvicto, es exiliado por el Vaticano a un pueblo remoto de España. La tranquilidad de esta Villa se verá alterada por una serie de fenómenos paranormales y hechos sin explicación que pronto se relacionarán con el nuevo párroco. Paco, el ingenuo alcalde y Elena, una inquieta veterinaria, tratarán de desvelar los secretos del pasado del cura y el significado de la antigua moneda que Vergara mantiene oculta. Poco a poco, este insólito trío de héroes se encontrará inmerso en una conspiración global: la batalla por el control de las treinta monedas por las que el apóstol Judas lscariote traicionó a Jesús de Nazaret.

En 30 Monedas te pondrás en la piel de los tres personajes principales de la trama, el Padre Vergara, el Alcalde Paco y la veterinaria Elena. Deberás investigar los sucesos paranormales que se suceden en el pueblo, enfrentarse a seres de otro mundo e intentar sabotear los planes de las fuerzas del mal. Lograrás tu objetivo si completas las misiones que irán apareciendo al principio de cada capítulo al mismo tiempo que evitas que los Cainitas se hagan con la Moneda que custodias, ya que si consiguen hacerse con la última Moneda de Judas, las consecuencias serán devastadoras para la humanidad.

boardgame.name: Closing Bell
boardgame.description:
"In this stock market game you will invest your dice, hoping ot score big points when the market closes. Careful... you could bust and go home empty-handed!"

This game is played in rounds of 4 market phases. There is a set of market dice that are rolled secretly by keeping them under a cup. Rolling your dice and then you can choose one value to lock. Once everyone has decided, uncover the market dice. If you didn't match any of the market dice, you are now out and score nothing. Did you match an unlocked value on a market die at least once, but not the locked value? You can continue playing, but you don't score any points this round. If you match the locked dice to the market dice, you can choose to set aside these for scoring or continue to the next round to push your luck for more points.

The points scored go up each round, but the number of market dice rolled go down. Locked dice remain locked from round ot round.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Crapsize
boardgame.description:
"You and the other players are competing to contract cargo ships which will bring valuable goods to port. Staying out at sea too long is risky, as weather can endanger your entire fleet. Will you gamble on long voyages for big money, or will you play it safe and stay close to home?"

Shipping lanes are made up of 7 cards 1-6 and another for scoring. You roll dice not at sea and can choose pairs to go to sea or not. One die chooses where to start and the other is the value of the cargo.

Then you roll two dice to see if a storm shows up and whether you lose any of your ships. Ships lost are removed and can be rerolled again next turn.

Finally move your ships forward (towards the lower number), if any move to zero and onto the scoring card earning points through a multiplication; doubles can net you a couple of bonus points.

If anyone reaches the 100 point goal or more the highest score wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Contest of Powers
Starcie Mocy
boardgame.description:
Role-play gods and goddesses of European pantheons in deadly skirmish for Heavens! Deduce who's your ally and who's your enemy, while bluffing your way out of intrigues. Fast and rules-friendly game, brimming with player interaction.

Your goal is to determine who is your 2 allied players and then, eliminate all other players before they get you. Alternatively, you may gather enough Power from Otherworld and sacrifice it on your Pantheon's altar.

Every round you take two actions, which will determine your position on Transcendency Oak, available power & artifacts (in form of cards) and your Stamina. You may engage in duels, battles and rituals - or simply just lick your wounds and plan your revenge.

boardgame.name: Monopoly Bid
Monopoly: Encan
Monopoly: KIDS
boardgame.description:
The Monopoly Bid game is a game of chance, luck, and strategy as players bid in blind auctions, pay with money cards, steal properties with Action cards, and change their luck with Wild cards. Played in rounds, everyone gets a chance to host an auction. When it's time to bid on a property, players choose how much money they want to risk. Then everyone shouts, "1, 2, 3, Bid!" and lays their money cards down. The player who bid the most money gets that property. Collect 3 property sets to win.

—description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Cat Capers: Museum Heist
boardgame.description:
Gather the family for a clever game of quick captures with Cat Capers! Cat Capers is an interactive tabletop card game for up to 6 players. To play, line up the 5 3D objects in a circle and shuffle the deck of cards. Each player must sit on one hand throughout the game, where the object is to identify the match or missing object on the card in play. Be the first to capture the right (or missing!) object, and keep that card. If you grab the wrong object, you must return your card randomly into the deck. Collect the most cards to become the ultimate cat caper!

Cat Capers includes 5 3D objects and 60 playing cards.
